benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/customFields - Retrieve bundle custom fields

covered: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios (TC01-TC03, TC11-TC12, TC14, TC19, TC15) verify successful retrieval for valid bundleId and various audit parameter values.
Empty Response: TC04 covers the behavior when a bundle has no custom fields (empty JSON array).
Query Parameters: Valid and invalid audit values are exercised (TC01-TC03, TC07, TC13, TC18) and handling of extra/unknown query parameters is tested (TC10).
Error Handling: Common error responses for invalid bundleId format and missing bundle (TC05, TC06) are present; also service/unavailability error conditions are covered (TC09, TC16).
Security: Injection/XSS attempts are addressed (TC17, TC18).
Performance/Load-ish: Large datasets and timing behavior are considered (TC14) and concurrent requests are exercised (TC19).
Content-Type/Structure: Response format and schema are validated (TC01, TC20).
gaps: Pagination: No scenarios explicitly cover pagination semantics (page/limit/offset) or behavior when results span multiple pages; guideline requests pagination verification for large datasets.
Caching Behavior: Missing tests for caching headers and conditional requests (ETag, If-None-Match, Cache-Control, Last-Modified) and correct 304 handling.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests for rate limiting, throttling behavior, or proper 429 responses under excessive requests.
Authorization Granularity: While 401 is included, there is no test for forbidden (403) scenarios or role/permission-based access restrictions (if applicable).
Response Schema Edge Cases: Although schema matching is asserted, there are no negative tests for malformed response bodies or partial/missing fields returned by dependent services.
HTTP 500 Handling: General server-side unexpected errors (500) are not explicitly tested beyond service-unavailable (503).
Caching + Audit Integration: No tests combine audit parameter values with caching or verify how audit-level affects cacheability or headers.
Content-Encoding and Large Payloads: No tests for very large response payloads (beyond count) or content-encoding handling (gzip, chunking).
Rate/Load Impact on Dependent Services: While TC16 checks audit service unavailability, there are no tests for degraded performance (timeouts) of dependencies and resulting timeouts/error codes.
recommendations: Add explicit pagination tests: create setups where custom fields exceed typical page sizes and verify paging parameters, correct counts, next/previous links (if applicable), and consistent results across pages.
Add caching tests: verify presence and correctness of Cache-Control, ETag, Last-Modified headers; test conditional GETs (If-None-Match) expecting 304 when unchanged.
Add rate limiting tests: simulate bursts of requests to verify 429 or other throttling behavior and that appropriate Retry-After headers are present.
Expand authorization tests: include 403 forbidden cases and role-based access tests (if API restricts some users), and validate token expiry handling.
Add 500/exception tests: simulate unexpected server errors to ensure API returns appropriate 5xx codes and safe error payloads.
Test large payload and encoding: verify behavior and performance when responses are very large (payload size), and that content-encoding is handled correctly.
Combine audit and caching tests: ensure audit=FULL/MINIMAL/NONE interactions with caching are well-defined and tested (e.g., do FULL responses bypass caches?).
Add schema robustness tests: simulate dependent services returning partial/malformed custom field objects and validate API sanitization and error responses.

Add more precise performance/load tests: beyond “acceptable response time” include quantifiable thresholds and automated checks under load, and tests for dependency timeouts leading to graceful degradation.
